result.execSummary:
The defendant Megan A. Pfaff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Writings or Objects, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE has failed to appear.  Atty Chapman makes record.  Off the record Atty Chapman and the Court try to phone the DE.  Court:  5 minute recess.  10:13 AM  Back on the record - court calls case.  Atty Chapman addressed the Court - DE called and states she is on her way but car broke down.  Court will allow DE to appear via phone.   Court calls number to contact DE.  DE appears via phone.  Court makes record.  State addressed the Court will acknowledge DE has paid $3000.00.  Atty Chapman makes further arguement as to the balance of $784.00.  Amy Nigbor called - sworn by Deputy Clerk - questioned by the Court.  Atty Chapman questions witness.  Witness is released by the Court.   State makes arguement.  Atty Chapman makes arguement.

COURT:  finds DE Paid $3000.00 - no evidence that the balance has been paid   - $784.00 short and is in violation of the agreement
  Grants states motion to enter judgment of conviction on count 1 -

State w/held sentence and probation will be recommendation
Atty Chapman feels would be cleaner but is fine proceeding today.  DE wishes to proceed today.  Court avised her as to her right to be in person for sentencing.  DE wishes to proceed today.  Court finds DE has freely waived her right to be present today in person.
State requests sentence be w/held and probation 18 month - costs - restitution balance of $784.00 to estate of George Renstrand (executor: Julie Carbalis)   /   Atty Chapman makes arguement requests 12 months probation.  

Court:  Sentence w/held probation 6 months - costs of $140.00 - restitution of $784.00 to the estate of George Renstrand to be paid within 6 months - report to DOC within 24 hours - any conditions DOC may impose

Defendant Megan A. Pfaff in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Chapman addressed the Court.  Court questions the State.  State makes stmt.  Court makes stmt.  Atty Chapman stipulates that DOC states restitution is not paid.  Court addressed the DE.  Atty Chapman calls - Megan Pfaff - sworn by Deputy Clerk - examined Atty Chapman.  3 exhibits marked - receipts as to restitution  1 - copy of money order

Court continues to questions witness.  Atty Chapman questions the witness.  State makes closing arguement.  Atty Chapman makes arguement.

Court:   w/holds decision so Atty can find witness to testify on behalf of the defendant 
   Exhibits 1 -4 are received.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 12, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
From Judge

Defendant Megan A. Pfaff in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court appears via phone.  DE states PD is still trying to obtain an attorney for her.  Court addressed her.  DE is on probation until 2019 for Sawyer County also on probation in Washburn County.  Court continues DEj needs to obtain an attorney.  DE wishes to have an attorney.  Court will appear in person.  If no attorney by then she is to have a letter from the PD stating the efforts they have made to obtain and attorney and her efforts.  Court will send letter instead.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 9, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Megan A. Pfaff in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge Eaton appearing by phone in the Sawyer County Courtroom.
DE states she has contacted the Public Defender multiple times, but was unable to obtain an attorney. She still wishes to have counsel.  DA makes statement.  Court reschedules Motion Hearing on State's motion to proceed to sentencing.  DE states she does not object to Judge appearing by phone or video for hearing, told she can address issue further once counsel is appointed.   Motion hearing scheduled for June 8, 2017 at 08:15 am.
DE still trying to get PD. PD office can not locate PD as of 5/25/17 @ 9:49 am. Change Motion Hearing to Status per Judge Eaton
Motion hearing on May 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Megan A. Pfaff in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court was notified by Atty Jim McLaughlin that he no longer represents the DE.  DE requests counsel and Court finds good cause to postpone hearing on State's motion to proceed with sentencing.   DE to contact public defender's office.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.
Court approves state's request for state witness to appear by telephone.

records.addlTxt: Deferred Judgment of Conviction Agreeement

Defendant Megan A. Pfaff in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts DEF pleads NC to all 3 counts, Court enters deferred agreement on ct#1, finds DEF guilty on cts 2 and 3 .
Court approves deferred agreement on ct #1 which requires DEF to comply with terms of probation in ct#2 and #3.  no contact with George Rehnstrand restitution to George Rehnstrand in the amount of 3784.00 plus surcharges, keep DA notified of any change of address or phone; 
Count #2 court withholds sentence  places DEF on 2 years probation conditions of probation fine $50.00 plus costs restitution to George Rehnstrand, no contact with George Rehnstrand.  
Count #3 court withholds sentence  places DEF on 2 years probation conditions of probation fine $50.00 plus costs restitution to George Rehnstrand, no contact with George Rehnstrand.   Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.
